alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 05 at 9:48PM PST until January 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves around 21 feet expected. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Humboldt and Mendocino Coast Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Saturday.. . * IMPACTS...Occasional larger waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
